result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert P Darruda

records.addlTxt:
8:34 AM - Case not called on the Record
Intern Abigail Kincheloe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Robert P Darruda in court. 
Defendant indicates that he has retained Attorney Patrick Rupich.
Attorney Rupick could not make the court date today.
Defendant requests another hearing date.  Court grants.
Hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:45 a.m.
Case not called on the record.
Attorney Kristi Gordon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Robert P Darruda in court. 
Defendant requests additional time to obtain counsel.  Court grants.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:47 PM   File not called on the record.
Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Robert P Darruda in court.  
Defendant requests additional time to retain an Attorney.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea and Sentencing hearing on 06-30-2022 moved from 3:45 pm to 2:00 pm - defendant notified by phone on 06-30-2022 at 9:00 am (mjs)
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 30, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

3:09 PM   File not called on the record.
Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Robert P Darruda in court.  
State to provide the defendant a global offer.
Defendant requests a different date for plea/sentencing.  Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

01:45 PM Defendant Robert P Darruda in court.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant will proceed without counsel.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
